original_text: In this section we wish to calculate the cross section for the absorption of massless scalars by the self-dual string in the world volume of the M-theory five-brane. We will adopt an entirely world volume approach similar to that of [21–23]. We begin by writing the equation satisfied by the s-wave with energy ω, φ(r,t)=φ(r)eiωt, of the linear fluctuations of the four overall transverse scalars about the self-dual string, (it is known that there are problems when one considers higher angular momentum modes [23], one must take care with the validity of the linearized approximation, this is discussed in [13]): (15)ρ−3ddρρ3ddρ+1+R6ω6ρ6φ(ρ)=0, where ρ=rω, R=Q1/3ℓp. Note, as pointed out by [11] world volume solitons have a much sharper potential than the Coulomb type potential typical of brane solutions in supergravity; thus this scattering is different to that of the string in six-dimensional supergravity. Nevertheless, for small ωR one may solve this problem by matching an approximate solution in the inner region to an approximate solution in the outer region; this follows closely the supergravity calculation [24].
original_translation: En esta sección deseamos calcular la sección transversal para la absorción de escalares sin masa por la cuerda auto-dual en el volumen del mundo de la cinco-brana de la teoría M. Adoptaremos un enfoque de volumen mundial completamente similar al de [21–23]. Comenzamos escribiendo la ecuación satisfecha por la onda s con energía ω, φ(r,t)=φ(r)eiωt, de las fluctuaciones lineales de los cuatro escalares transversales generales sobre la cuerda auto-dual, (se sabe que hay problemas cuando se consideran modos de momento angular más alto [23], se debe tener cuidado con la validez de la aproximación linealizada, esto se discute en [13]): (15)ρ−3ddρρ3ddρ+1+R6ω6ρ6φ(ρ)=0, donde ρ=rω, R=Q1/3ℓp. Como señaló [11], los solitones de volumen mundial tienen un potencial mucho más agudo que el potencial tipo Coulomb típico de las soluciones de branas en la supergravedad; por lo tanto, esta dispersión es diferente a la de la cuerda en la supergravedad de seis dimensiones. Sin embargo, para valores pequeños de ωR, se puede resolver este problema emparejando una solución aproximada en la región interna con una solución aproximada en la región externa; esto sigue de cerca el cálculo de supergravedad [24].
original_sentences: In this section we wish to calculate the cross section for the absorption of massless scalars by the self-dual string in the world volume of the M-theory five-brane.
We will adopt an entirely world volume approach similar to that of [21–23].

We begin by writing the equation satisfied by the s-wave with energy ω, φ(r,t)=φ(r)eiωt, of the linear fluctuations of the four overall transverse scalars about the self-dual string, (it is known that there are problems when one considers higher angular momentum modes [23], one must take care with the validity of the linearized approximation, this is discussed in [13]): (15)ρ−3ddρρ3ddρ+1+R6ω6ρ6φ(ρ)=0, where ρ=rω, R=Q1/3ℓp.

Note, as pointed out by [11] world volume solitons have a much sharper potential than the Coulomb type potential typical of brane solutions in supergravity; thus this scattering is different to that of the string in six-dimensional supergravity.

Nevertheless, for small ωR one may solve this problem by matching an approximate solution in the inner region to an approximate solution in the outer region; this follows closely the supergravity calculation [24].

original_annotated_sentences:
In this section we wish to calculate the cross section for the absorption of
massless scalars
by the self-dual string in the world volume of the M-theory five-brane.
We will adopt an entirely world volume approach similar to that of [21–23].

We begin by writing the equation satisfied by the s-wave with energy ω, φ(r,t)=φ(r)eiωt, of the linear fluctuations of the four overall transverse scalars about the self-dual string, (it is known that there are problems when one considers higher angular momentum modes [23], one must take care with the validity of the linearized approximation, this is discussed in [13]): (15)ρ−3ddρρ3ddρ+1+R6ω6ρ6φ(ρ)=0, where ρ=rω, R=Q1/3ℓp.

Note, as pointed out by [11] world volume solitons have a much sharper potential than the Coulomb type potential typical of brane solutions in supergravity; thus this scattering is different to that of the string in six-dimensional supergravity.

Nevertheless, for small ωR one may solve this problem by matching an approximate solution in the inner region to an approximate solution in the outer region; this follows closely the supergravity calculation [24].

por la cuerda auto-dual en el volumen del mundo de la cinco-brana de la teoría M. Adoptaremos un enfoque de volumen mundial completamente similar al de [21–23]. Comenzamos escribiendo la ecuación satisfecha por la onda s con energía ω, φ(r,t)=φ(r)eiωt, de las fluctuaciones lineales de los cuatro escalares transversales generales sobre la cuerda auto-dual, (se sabe que hay problemas cuando se consideran modos de momento angular más alto [23], se debe tener cuidado con la validez de la aproximación linealizada, esto se discute en [13]): (15)ρ−3ddρρ3ddρ+1+R6ω6ρ6φ(ρ)=0, donde ρ=rω, R=Q1/3ℓp. Como señaló [11], los solitones de volumen mundial tienen un potencial mucho más agudo que el potencial tipo Coulomb típico de las soluciones de branas en la supergravedad; por lo tanto, esta dispersión es diferente a la de la cuerda en la supergravedad de seis dimensiones. Sin embargo, para valores pequeños de ωR, se puede resolver este problema emparejando una solución aproximada en la región interna con una solución aproximada en la región externa; esto sigue de cerca el cálculo de supergravedad [24].

original_annotated_sentences:
In this section we wish to calculate the cross section for the absorption of massless scalars by the self-dual string in the world volume of the
M-theory five-brane
.
We will adopt an entirely world volume approach similar to that of [21–23].

We begin by writing the equation satisfied by the s-wave with energy ω, φ(r,t)=φ(r)eiωt, of the linear fluctuations of the four overall transverse scalars about the self-dual string, (it is known that there are problems when one considers higher angular momentum modes [23], one must take care with the validity of the linearized approximation, this is discussed in [13]): (15)ρ−3ddρρ3ddρ+1+R6ω6ρ6φ(ρ)=0, where ρ=rω, R=Q1/3ℓp.

Note, as pointed out by [11] world volume solitons have a much sharper potential than the Coulomb type potential typical of brane solutions in supergravity; thus this scattering is different to that of the string in six-dimensional supergravity.

Nevertheless, for small ωR one may solve this problem by matching an approximate solution in the inner region to an approximate solution in the outer region; this follows closely the supergravity calculation [24].

onda s
con energía ω, φ(r,t)=φ(r)eiωt, de las fluctuaciones lineales de los cuatro escalares transversales generales sobre la cuerda auto-dual, (se sabe que hay problemas cuando se consideran modos de momento angular más alto [23], se debe tener cuidado con la validez de la aproximación linealizada, esto se discute en [13]): (15)ρ−3ddρρ3ddρ+1+R6ω6ρ6φ(ρ)=0, donde ρ=rω, R=Q1/3ℓp.
